title: How many ways are there to arrange 5-digit numbers (from numbers 0-9), with exactly only 2 of those digits being the same numbers? - Quora

response.answer_text: I assume that 5-digit numbers starting with 0 on the left don’t count because otherwise they would be either 4-digit or 3-digit numbers depending on whether the number contains one zero or two zeroes on the left. We can classify the possible numbers as follows: (1) No zeroes. In this case, the 5-digit number consists of 4 non-zero different digits 1 - 9 with one of the four digits being duplicated. Number of arrangements is C(9,4)5!/2 = 7560. (2) One zero. In this case, the 5-digit number consists of the one zero and 3 non-zero different digits 1 - 9 with one of the three digits being duplicated. Number of arrangements, taking into account that the one zero can’t be the first digit on the left side, is C(9,3)(5!/2 - 4!/2) = 4032. (3) Two zeroes. In this case, the 5-digit number consists of the two zeroes and 3 non-zero different digits 1 - 9, where a zero can’t be the first digit on the left side. Number of arrangements is C(9,3)(5!/2 - 4!) = 3024. Adding the three results, we get 14616 total arrangements.

In 5-digit number we have 4 distinct digits and one repeated digit.First we have to find all 4-digit combination of distinct digits.10*9*8*7 Now we can put one extra digit of this 4 digits on different positions to get 5-digit combination.First digit repeated, this extra digit can go on position 2 or 3 or 4 or 5 (4 comb.)Second digit repeated on position 3,4 or 5 (3 comb.)Third digit repeated on position 4,5 (2 comb.)Fourth digit repeated on position 5 (1 comb)Total is 1+2+3+4=10 10*9*8*7*10 This number includes leading 0 and 00 combinations which have to be removed. In case of leading 00:first and second digits are 0, other digits are from 1–91*1*9*8*7 In case of leading 0 we have two cases. 0 is repeating on place 3 or 4 or 5 : 1*9*8*7*3 and second case first digit is 0 and remaining 4 digits have 3 distinct and one repeated digit from set 1–9. Second digit repeated on position 3,4 or 5 (3 comb.)Third digit repeated on position 4,5 (2 comb.)Fourth digit repeated on position 5 (1 comb)Total is 1+2+3=61*9*8*7*6 10*9*8*7*10 - 1*1*9*8*7 - 1*9*8*7*3 - 1*9*8*7*6=9*8*7*(100–1–3–6)=9*8*7*90=45360
